title: Question 1
stimulusHtml: The student response earns one point for naming Anchises
descriptions: The student response earns one point for naming Anchises

title: Question 2
stimulusHtml:
The student response can earn one point with this answer:

— — | — ∪ ∪ | — — | — ∪∪ | — ∪ ∪ | — —

Describent radioˬet surgentia sidera dicent

Note: To receive full credit, students need only mark long (—) and short (∪) syllables; they may also mark elisions ( ˬ ) or divisions between metrical feet ( | ) but are not required to do so.

title: Question 3
stimulusHtml:
The student response can earn up to two points: 1 point for the occupation and 1 point for the supporting Latin.

Any one of the following answers is acceptable:

Sculptor/Artist: (in bronze): “Excudent alii spirantia mollius aera”; (in marble): “Excudent alii vivos de marmorevultus”

Lawyer: “orabunt causas melius”

Astronomer: “caelique meatus describent radio” “surgentia sidera dicent”
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the following points:

1 point for the occupation and 1 point for the supporting Latin.

Any one of the following answers is acceptable:

Sculptor/Artist: (in bronze): “Excudent alii spirantia mollius aera”; (in marble): “Excudent alii vivos de marmorevultus”

Lawyer: “orabunt causas melius”

Astronomer: “caelique meatus describent radio” “surgentia sidera dicent”

Student response earns one of the following points:

1 point for the occupation and 1 point for the supporting Latin.

Any one of the following answers is acceptable:

Sculptor/Artist: (in bronze): “Excudent alii spirantia mollius aera”; (in marble): “Excudent alii vivos de marmorevultus”

Lawyer: “orabunt causas melius”

Astronomer: “caelique meatus describent radio” “surgentia sidera dicent”

Student response earns all of the following points:

1 point for the occupation and 1 point for the supporting Latin.

Any one of the following answers is acceptable:

Sculptor/Artist: (in bronze): “Excudent alii spirantia mollius aera”; (in marble): “Excudent alii vivos de marmorevultus”

Lawyer: “orabunt causas melius”

Astronomer: “caelique meatus describent radio” “surgentia sidera dicent”

title: Question 4
stimulusHtml:
The student response can earn up to 2 points:1 point for the translation and 1 point for the mood.

Translation: “remember/be mindful”

Mood: imperative
descriptions:
Student provides neither the correct translation nor mood:

Translation: “remember/be mindful”

Mood: imperative

Student provides either correct translation or mood:

Translation: “remember/be mindful”

Mood: imperative

Student provides both the correct translation and mood:

Translation: “remember/be mindful”

Mood: imperative

title: Question 5
stimulusHtml:
The student response can earn up to 2 points: 1 point for the occasion and 1 point for the reason(s) for Aeneas's actions.

Occasion: the fight between Aeneas and Turnus when Aeneas refuses to spare Turnus/killsTurnus

Reason: Aeneas sees Pallas’s sword-belt/baldric worn by Turnus and this enrages him
descriptions:
The student response does not correctly identify either the occasion OR the reason.

Occasion: the fight between Aeneas and Turnus when Aeneas refuses to spare Turnus/killsTurnus

Reason: Aeneas sees Pallas’s sword-belt/baldric worn by Turnus and this enrages him

The student response correctly identifies the occasion OR the reason.

Occasion: the fight between Aeneas and Turnus when Aeneas refuses to spare Turnus/killsTurnus

Reason: Aeneas sees Pallas’s sword-belt/baldric worn by Turnus and this enrages him

The student response correctly identifies the occasion and the reason.

Occasion: the fight between Aeneas and Turnus when Aeneas refuses to spare Turnus/killsTurnus

Reason: Aeneas sees Pallas’s sword-belt/baldric worn by Turnus and this enrages him
